name: Riparian buffer width
functionStatement: Species interactions sustain biodiversity, restrain invasives, and build resilience to disturbance.
descriptionMarkdown: ~30 m or appropriate for shade/leaf input if historically expected, unless narrower is normal (prairie).
howToMeasureMarkdown: Measure riparian buffer width and vegetation structure in GIS along the reach.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Little native vegetation. Banks mostly lawn or invasives.
Criteria: Corridor very narrow or absent. Native plants largely missing.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Thin or patchy vegetation along banks.
Criteria: Narrow corridor. Fragmented native cover with common invasives.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Mostly vegetated corridor with some gaps.
Criteria: Moderate width and structure. Some invasive patches present.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Continuous native trees, shrubs, and groundcover.
Criteria: Wide, intact native corridor with minimal invasives.
